subject: Why is it considered an error if there is no test in the file?
msgSnippet: From the faq the pattern everyone else seems to be using is that their tests are in a seperate java file from their code.  I d like to spinkle test methods
messageBody:
From the faq the pattern everyone else seems to be using is that their
tests are in a seperate java file from their code. I'd like to
spinkle test methods throughout my code, so the test can be right next
to the code it is testing. I'd like to create a junit ant task that
just runs on my whole codebase, but not all of my classes will have
test methods and I'll get an error for each class that doesn't (and I
don't want to have to explictily add each class to my build.xml file
when I add a test). So how do I tell junit that it isn't an error if
a class does not have a test method?
